space.arim.universal.util

Class UniversalUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • space.arim.universal.util.UniversalUtil

  • public final class UniversalUtil
extends Object
    UniversalUtil: Main class

    The most common usage of this class is to check synchronisation: isAsynchronous()

    To retrieve an instance:
    * get()
    * getByClass(Class)
    * threadLocal()
    * getOrDefault(Class, Supplier)
    Author:
    A248

    • Field Detail

      • COMMON_GSON

        public static final com.google.gson.Gson COMMON_GSON
        Since Gson is thread-safe, this is a common Gson for any class to use.

      • DEFAULT_ID

        public static final String DEFAULT_ID
        The main instance id
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • threadLocal

        public static ThreadLocal<UniversalUtil> threadLocal()
        UniversalUtil instances are thread-safe; however, you may wish for a thread-specific instance.

        A thread-specific instance of UniversalUtil will take the thread itself as the main thread. Thus, UniversalUtil.threadLocal().asynchronous() will always return false.
        Returns:
        ThreadLocal - a ThreadLocal

      • getByClass

        public static UniversalUtil getByClass(Class<?> clazz)
        Retrieves a UniversalUtil instance by class. If no instance for the classname exists, a new one is created.

        This is the preferred approach to using your own UniversalUtil instances.
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the class
        Returns:
        UniversalUtil - the instance. If none exists, a new instance is created.

      • getOrDefault

        public static UniversalUtil getOrDefault(Class<?> clazz,
                                         Supplier<UniversalUtil> defaultSupplier)
        Gets a UniversalUtil by class with a default value, issued by the Supplier, if it does not exist.

        This method is useful for checking for a specific instance and falling back to a default value.
        Parameters:
        clazz - - see getByClass(Class)
        defaultSupplier - - from which to return back default values.
        Returns:
        UniversalUtil - a registered instance if the id exists, otherwise the default value

      • get

        public static UniversalUtil get()
        Gets the main instance of UniversalUtil
        Returns:
        UniversalUtil - the instance

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the id of this UniversalUtil instance.

        The current implementation:
        * For the main instance, it is DEFAULT_ID
        * For classname instances retrieved with getByClass(Class), it is "class-" followed by the classname
        * For thread-local instances retrieved with threadLocal(), it is "thread-" + System.currentTimeMillis() at instantiation time + "-" + the thread name
        However, these values may change.
        Returns:
        String - the id

      • isAsynchronous

        public boolean isAsynchronous()
        Returns whether code is running asynchronously.

        Note that the "main thread" is taken to mean the thread on which the instance is initialised.
        It is thus recommended to fetch your own instance with getByClass(Class) if you plan on using this method.
        E.g.:
        UniversalUtil myUtil = UniversalUtil.getByClassname(MyClass.class.getName());
        By making your own instance on the main thread, you guarantee the validity of this method return
        Returns:
        true if and only if asynchronous

      • getFromMapRecursive

        public static <T> T getFromMapRecursive(Map<String,Object> map,
                                        String key,
                                        Class<T> type)
        Recursively retrieves a specified type of object from a Map of potentially nested maps.
        Periods delineate a nested map.
        This method is particularly useful for configuration loaded thorugh SnakeYAML.
        Specifically, if one must retrieve the yaml value key1.subkey.value as an Integer from the map configValues, one should call use getFromMapRecursive(configValues, "key1.subkey.value", Integer.class)
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the type to retrieve. If the object found is not this type, null is returned
        Parameters:
        map - - the map from which to retrieve recursively
        key - - the key string
        type - - the type class
        Returns:
        the object if found, null if not
